title: How to get decent FPS? 30+
body:
Hi everyone, 

I'm looking for a way to increase my FPS to around 60+, right now I'm on 30-60fps and when I play on overwatch I get less than 20 fps.

Is there a way to increase this? If the only way to increase FPS is to get a 'better' graphics card please explain I'm clueless about computers.

Also, why is it sometimes I have my Spotify running or chrome I get FPS drops?

replies.body:
Hey there,

Sounds to me like your system just doesn't meet the cut to run games such as league, overwatch etc with high framerates.

Could you please do the following for me so that I may make some suggestions as to what you can do.

Follow the steps outlined in this [guide on how to obtain a directx diagnostic](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq5) instead of attaching the file to a support ticket however, please upload it to a host of your choice (Google drive works well) and reply with a link here.

> [{quoted}](name=SephirothSG,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=cZ0R7lwr,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-05-03T07:13:33.751+0000)
>
> Hey there,
> 
> Sounds to me like your system just doesn't meet the cut to run games such as league, overwatch etc with high framerates.
> 
> Could you please do the following for me so that I may make some suggestions as to what you can do.
> 
> Follow the steps outlined in this [guide on how to obtain a directx diagnostic](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq5) instead of attaching the file to a support ticket however, please upload it to a host of your choice (Google drive works well) and reply with a link here.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B5L-HUWJc86WMlRWSERnS2MwM2M/view?usp=sharing <--- Link to the google doc

Hey man,

Looks like you've got a pretty decent system there, all you'll need is a graphics card.

If you aren't sure what that is or how to install the card once you've obtained one I'd recommend taking your computer to a shop and having them purchase and install the card for you.

> [{quoted}](name=SephirothSG,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=cZ0R7lwr,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-05-03T09:33:13.506+0000)
>
> Hey man,
> 
> Looks like you've got a pretty decent system there, all you'll need is a graphics card.
> 
> If you aren't sure what that is or how to install the card once you've obtained one I'd recommend taking your computer to a shop and having them purchase and install the card for you.

Thanks for the response.

graphics card?? Isn't that the intel 4000 thing I have on my PC at the moment? 
I don't think my PC is upgradable.

Are you using a laptop or a desktop computer?


Intel graphics is the onboard GPU. It will run most low spec games without issue however it will most definitely struggle on higher end games.

> [{quoted}](name=SephirothSG,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=cZ0R7lwr,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-05-05T09:14:09.671+0000)
>
> Are you using a laptop or a desktop computer?
> 
> 
> Intel graphics is the onboard GPU. It will run most low spec games without issue however it will most definitely struggle on higher end games.

Desktop computer.
Then it should be upgradeable, as I said. take it into a computer repair store or something similar and speak to them about it.
